title: Order whole numbers using powers of 10
description: Identifies, reads, writes, compares, and orders whole numbers using powers of 10.
detection_hint: Look for explicit reference to powers of 10 (10^n) and correct ordering or place-value reasoning.

mastery: Orders a mixed list of whole numbers using place value.
Explains ordering using 10^n or place-value shifts.
partial: Orders mostly correct but explanation incomplete.
Minor place-value slip fixed after prompt.
not_yet: Incorrect ordering; no reference to place value or powers of 10.

assessment_item_templates: Order: 8000, 3×10^3, 10^4, 75 000 from smallest to largest and explain.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Number structure > order whole numbers using powers of 10 (Y7)

title: Order whole numbers and decimals using powers of 10
description: Identifies, reads, writes, compares, and orders whole numbers and decimals using powers of 10.
detection_hint: Evidence of comparing decimals via place value and using 10^n shifts.

mastery: Correctly orders whole numbers and decimals; explains with place-value positions or ×10/÷10 reasoning.
partial: Correct ordering but vague explanation or 1 slip corrected on check.

assessment_item_templates: Order: 0.03, 3.5, 3.05, 3×10^1 and justify.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Number structure > order whole numbers & decimals using powers of 10 (Y8)

title: Find HCF and LCM of small numbers
description: Finds HCF of two numbers under 100 and LCM of two numbers under 10 using factors or multiples.
detection_hint: Look for factor lists, prime factors, or multiples tables; correct selection of HCF/LCM.

mastery: Computes HCF/LCM correctly in ≥3 problems; shows working.
partial: Method correct but one arithmetic slip.
Correct after hint to list factors/multiples.
not_yet: Chooses wrong concept (e.g., uses sum instead of LCM/HCF).

assessment_item_templates: Find HCF(84, 60) and LCM(6, 8). Show your method.

title: Use prime factorisation and HCF
description: Represents a number as a product of primes and uses factorisation to find HCF of two numbers.
detection_hint: Look for prime-factor trees and use of common prime powers for HCF.

mastery: Writes correct prime factorizations and derives HCF from them.
Explains why shared primes produce the HCF.
partial: Correct factorization but HCF step incomplete.
Arithmetic slip in prime powers fixed after prompt.
not_yet: Incorrect or non-prime factors; HCF not justified.

assessment_item_templates: Express 180 and 168 as prime factors and find HCF.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Number structure > prime factorisation; HCF from prime factors (Y8)

title: Use exponents and identify square roots
description: Uses exponents to represent repeated multiplication and identifies square roots of square numbers to at least 100.
detection_hint: Look for exponent notation and correct square–square-root pairs.

mastery: Writes powers for repeated multiplication; identifies √n for perfect squares ≤100.
partial: Understands idea but mislabels a non-square (e.g., √50=7.1 without estimation).
not_yet: Does not use exponent notation; square roots mismatched.

assessment_item_templates: Write with exponents: 5×5×5×5; find √81 and √64.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Number structure > exponents & square roots (Y7)

title: Prime/composite properties and cube numbers
description: Identifies/justifies prime vs composite up to at least 100 and recognises cube numbers up to at least 125.
detection_hint: Evidence includes divisibility tests and 3D reasoning for cubes (n^3).

mastery: Classifies numbers accurately; lists cubes ≤125; justifies with divisibility/prime tests.
partial: Mostly correct classification; one cube misidentified.

assessment_item_templates: Classify: 91, 97, 100; list all cubes ≤125.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Number structure > prime/composite; cube numbers (Y8)

title: Use rounding and estimation to check calculations
description: Uses rounding and estimation to predict results and check reasonableness of calculations.
detection_hint: Look for benchmark use and inverse operations for checking.

mastery: Chooses sensible rounding and states if answer is reasonable; uses an inverse check at least once.
partial: Rounding applied but benchmark or check missing.

assessment_item_templates: Estimate 48×19 and explain; then compute exactly and compare.

title: Use estimation with benchmarks
description: Uses rounding, estimation, and benchmarks (e.g., 73%≈3/4) to check reasonableness.
detection_hint: Evidence of benchmark fractions/percents and inverse checks.

mastery: Applies benchmarks (½, ¼, ¾, etc.) and rounds sensibly to judge reasonableness.
partial: Benchmark selected but not clearly linked to judgement.

assessment_item_templates: Is 73% of 840 closer to 600 or 700? Explain using a benchmark.

title: Round whole numbers and decimals to specified places
description: Rounds whole numbers to any given power of 10 and decimals to nearest tenth/hundredth/whole.
detection_hint: Look for correct place-value marking and rounding rules (≥5 up).

mastery: Rounds a set of numbers correctly; explains decision digit.
partial: Minor rounding error; reasoning mostly sound.

assessment_item_templates: Round 53 786 to nearest thousand; 3.276 to nearest hundredth.

title: Round to thousandth and larger powers of 10
description: Rounds whole numbers to any specified power of 10 and decimals to the nearest tenth, hundredth, thousandth, or whole.
detection_hint: Look for rounding to 0.001 and consistent rules.

mastery: Accurate rounding including thousandths across varied numbers.
partial: Occasional thousandth error; other places correct.

assessment_item_templates: Round 0.00649 to nearest thousandth; 8 742 500 to nearest hundred thousand.

title: Recall facts and apply divisibility rules (2,3,5,9,10)
description: Recalls multiplication facts to 10×10 and applies divisibility rules for 2,3,5,9,10.
detection_hint: Look for quick fact recall and correct rule statements with examples/counterexamples.

mastery: Correctly applies each rule to classify numbers; gives reasoning.
partial: Minor slip (e.g., 9-rule sum-of-digits misapplied) corrected after prompt.
not_yet: States rules incorrectly or misclassifies repeatedly.

assessment_item_templates: Which of these are divisible by 9: 342, 713, 1 008? Explain.

title: Use divisibility rules 2–11
description: Identifies and describes divisibility rules for 2–11 and applies them to classify numbers.
detection_hint: Evidence of rule application including 7 and 11.

mastery: Correctly classifies a mixed set using stated rules and checks via computation where needed.
partial: States rules but misapplies to one number.
not_yet: Cannot state or apply several rules.

assessment_item_templates: For each number 231, 462, 715, 1001, decide divisible by 2–11 and justify.

title: Multiply whole numbers (multi-digit)
description: Multiplies whole numbers efficiently, including using the vertical-column method.
detection_hint: Look for layout with place-value alignment and estimation check.

mastery: Solves ≥3 multi-digit products; includes one estimation check.
partial: Correct method but one arithmetic slip.
not_yet: Layout confused; repeated errors without checking.

assessment_item_templates: Compute 368×47; show vertical method and an estimate.

title: Divide whole numbers by 1–2 digit divisors
description: Divides whole numbers by one- or two-digit divisors, representing remainders as fractions/decimals/rounded.
detection_hint: Look for single equals per line, and correct interpretation of remainders.

mastery: Solves ≥3 problems including one with a remainder shown in two forms.
partial: Procedure mostly correct; misinterprets remainder once.

assessment_item_templates: 327÷15; express as decimal and mixed number.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Operations > divide whole numbers 1–2 digit divisors (Y7)

title: Divide whole numbers (general)
description: Chooses appropriate method (long division, mental, digital tool) and justifies choice; represents remainders appropriately.
detection_hint: Look for justification of chosen method and correct remainder representation.

mastery: Solves varied divisions (incl. 3-digit by 2-digit) and justifies strategy.
not_yet: Wrong method choice leading to errors; no justification.

assessment_item_templates: Compute 1 764 ÷ 24; explain method choice and show checks.

title: Apply order of operations (GEMA)
description: Evaluates multi-step numeric expressions using grouped, exponents, multiplicative, additive order.
detection_hint: Evidence of stepwise working, one equals per line, and correct final value.

mastery: Correctly evaluates ≥3 expressions including brackets & exponents; shows steps and optional rule statement.
partial: Structure correct but one operation misplaced; fixes after prompt.
not_yet: No evidence of order; inconsistent answers.

assessment_item_templates: Evaluate: 5 + 2 × (8 − 3)^2

title: Order, compare, and locate integers; explore addition/subtraction
description: Orders and locates integers on a number line; explores addition/subtraction with visual models.
detection_hint: Look for number line diagrams and statements about movement direction.

mastery: Accurately orders/locates integers and models ± addition/subtraction on number lines/counters.
partial: Ordering correct but addition/subtraction model flawed.
not_yet: Confuses order or direction; misreads number line.

assessment_item_templates: Place −7, −2, 0, 4 on a number line; show −3 + 5 and −6 − (−2).
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Operations > integers order/locate and explore add/sub (Y7)

title: Operate with integers (order, compare, add, subtract)
description: Orders, compares, adds, and subtracts integers fluently and justifies results.
detection_hint: Look for generalisations (adding negative decreases; subtracting negative increases).

mastery: Solves ≥4 integer problems; includes one justification using a rule or model.
partial: Mostly correct; one sign slip fixed after check.

assessment_item_templates: Compute: −12 − 7, 4 + (−9), −5 − (−11); explain one using a rule.

title: Represent fractions, decimals (3dp), and percentages
description: Identifies, reads, writes, and represents fractions, decimals (to three places), and percentages.
detection_hint: Look for consistent notation and conversions between forms.

mastery: Represents the same quantity in FDP forms; uses correct notation.
partial: Minor notation slip (e.g., percent sign), corrected.
not_yet: Confuses percent vs decimal or improper notation.

assessment_item_templates: Write 0.375 as a fraction and a percentage; show reasoning.

title: Represent fractions, decimals, and percentages
description: Identifies, reads, writes, and represents fractions, decimals, and percentages.
detection_hint: Look for flexible switching among forms.

mastery: Represents quantities in multiple forms and chooses convenient form for a task.
partial: Correct but limited to one conversion.

assessment_item_templates: Express 7/20 as a decimal and percentage; explain.

title: Compare/order/convert between FDP (3dp)
description: Compares, orders, and converts between fractions, decimals (to three places), and percentages using benchmarks and equivalence.
detection_hint: Look for double number lines, benchmarks (½, ¼), or common denominators.

mastery: Orders mixed FDP sets; shows conversion steps or benchmark reasoning.
partial: Mostly correct ordering; one conversion slip.

assessment_item_templates: Order 0.48, 5/12, 49%; justify your order.

title: Compare/order/convert between FDP
description: Compares, orders, and converts between fractions, decimals, and percentages with flexible strategies.
detection_hint: Evidence of efficient strategy choice and justification.

mastery: Chooses efficient method (e.g., percent) and justifies ordering.

assessment_item_templates: Which is greater: 37% or 3/8? Explain.

title: Multiply/divide by 10, 100, 1000
description: Multiplies and divides numbers by 10, 100, 1000 using place-value shifts.
detection_hint: Look for PV charts and digit shifts left/right.

mastery: Accurately performs ×/÷ with correct digit shifts; explains direction.

assessment_item_templates: Compute: 3.46×100; 508÷1000; explain digit shifts.

title: Multiply/divide by powers of 10
description: Multiplies and divides numbers by powers of 10 (10^n) fluently.
detection_hint: Look for expression with 10^n and correct shifts.

mastery: Generalises pattern for any n; shows example with n>3.

assessment_item_templates: Write a rule for ×10^n and ÷10^n and apply for n=4.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Rational numbers > ×/÷ by powers of 10 (Y8)

title: Equivalent & simplified fractions; improper↔mixed

mastery: Simplifies and renames correctly across ≥3 items with explanation.

assessment_item_templates: Rename 27/9, 18/24, 7/3 into simplest/mixed forms.

detection_hint: Evidence of factor trees or prime factors in justification.

assessment_item_templates: Simplify 84/126; convert 11/4 to mixed; explain.

title: Multiply fractions/decimals by whole numbers
description: Multiplies fractions and decimals by whole numbers with estimation.
detection_hint: Look for vertical method for decimals and fraction-of-a-set reasoning.

mastery: Solves ≥3 items; includes an estimate and shows method.
not_yet: Repeated computation errors; no method shown.

assessment_item_templates: Compute 0.7×45; 3/5 of 45.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Rational numbers > multiply fractions/decimals by whole numbers (Y7)

title: Multiply fractions/decimals by whole numbers (Y8)
description: As Y7 with more complex numbers and justification of product size (identity idea).
detection_hint: Evidence of explaining when product is smaller than the whole for factor<1.

mastery: Explains product size vs factor; correct calculations.

assessment_item_templates: Explain why 0.4×120 < 120; compute 0.4×120.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Rational numbers > multiply fractions/decimals by whole numbers (Y8)

title: Find percent of a whole and find the whole

detection_hint: Look for 10%/5% strategies or decimal multiplication.

mastery: Solves both types across ≥2 problems; shows strategy.

assessment_item_templates: 25% is $100, what is the total? 35% of 120.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Rational numbers > percentage of whole/whole from part (Y7)

title: Find percent of a whole and find the whole (Y8)
description: As Y7 with more complex percentages and multi-step contexts.
detection_hint: Evidence of bar models or equations.

mastery: Solves multi-step percent problems; checks with estimation.
not_yet: Incorrect setup or no link to context.

assessment_item_templates: If 75% is $45, what is the total? Also find 32% of 250.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Rational numbers > percentage of whole/whole from part (Y8)

title: Add/subtract fractions with unlike denominators (to tenths)
description: Adds and subtracts fractions with different denominators of up to a tenth using equivalent fractions.
detection_hint: Look for LCM and renaming to common denominator.

mastery: Correctly adds/subtracts across ≥3 items; shows renaming.
not_yet: No common denominator or repeated errors.

assessment_item_templates: Compute 3/4 + 1/5; show your method.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Rational numbers > add/subtract fractions unlike denom (Y7)

title: Add/subtract fractions with unlike denominators
description: Adds and subtracts fractions with unlike denominators using equivalence and HCF/LCM reasoning.
detection_hint: Evidence of simplifying result.

mastery: Finds common denominator efficiently and simplifies answers.

assessment_item_templates: Compute 7/12 − 5/18 and simplify.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Rational numbers > add/subtract fractions unlike denom (Y8)

title: Add/subtract decimals (to 3dp)
description: Adds and subtracts decimals to three decimal places with estimation first.
detection_hint: Look for alignment of decimal points and a pre-estimate.

mastery: Accurate calculations with alignment and an estimate.

assessment_item_templates: Add 14.375 + 6.8; estimate first.

title: Add/subtract/multiply decimals
description: Adds, subtracts, and multiplies decimals with estimation checks.
detection_hint: Evidence of vertical layout for multiply and reasonableness check.

mastery: Solves a mixed set incl. multiplication; includes a check.

assessment_item_templates: Compute 3.6×1.25; explain why your answer is reasonable.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Rational numbers > operate with decimals (Y8)

title: Use proportional reasoning for multiplicative relationships
description: Explores multiplicative relationships using ratios, unit rates, and scaling in real contexts.
detection_hint: Look for unit rate or factor-of-change reasoning; bar/double number lines.

mastery: Solves ≥2 contexts using multiplicative strategies; explains reasoning.
not_yet: Additive-only approach in multiplicative context; incorrect.

assessment_item_templates: If the ratio red:blue is 3:7 and red=18, how many blue? How many total?

title: Use proportional reasoning for unequal sharing
description: Uses ratios to share quantities in unequal proportions.
detection_hint: Look for part-to-part scaling and total-to-part reasoning via bar models.

mastery: Correctly shares amounts with given ratios; shows representation.
not_yet: Equal sharing or additive method used incorrectly.

assessment_item_templates: Share $100 in the ratio 1:3; show using a bar model.

title: Calculate total cost and change
description: Calculates totals and change accurately for money transactions.
detection_hint: Look for column addition/subtraction with decimal alignment and rounding to cents.

mastery: Computes totals and change correctly across ≥3 scenarios; includes a check.
partial: Correct result; minor rounding omission clarified.

assessment_item_templates: You buy items costing $5.60, $12.40, $3.95. Pay with $25. What is the change?
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Financial mathematics > total cost and change (Y7)

title: Create and compare personal finance plans
description: Creates and compares weekly/monthly/yearly finance plans (saving/phone/budget/BNPL) and justifies 'best deal' to personal priorities.
detection_hint: Look for use of tables/spreadsheets and explicit criteria (cost, flexibility, risk).

mastery: Builds at least two plans, compares quantitatively, and justifies a choice.

assessment_item_templates: Compare 3 phone plans over 12 months; choose one with reasons.
teaching_sequence_refs: Number > Financial mathematics > create/compare finance plans (Y8)

title: Apply percentage discounts
description: Applies percentage discounts to prices, using decimal multipliers or subtract-from-whole strategies.
detection_hint: Look for 0.x multipliers and/or 'find 10%/5%' strategy with rounding to cents.

mastery: Correctly computes discounted prices across ≥3 items; shows method.
partial: Correct but rounding or cents formatting off.
not_yet: Wrong base or percent; no method shown.

assessment_item_templates: Apply 35% discount to $180 in two ways; compare.

title: Solve one-step linear equations
description: Forms and solves one-step linear equations; checks solutions by substitution.
detection_hint: Look for inverse operations and balanced steps.

mastery: Solves ≥3 one-step equations; shows inverse step and check.
not_yet: Treats as arithmetic, not equation; no variable isolation.

assessment_item_templates: Solve and check: t + 7 = 12; 2s = 14.
teaching_sequence_refs: Algebra > Equations & Relationships > form and solve one-step equations (Y7)

title: Solve one- and two-step linear equations
description: Forms and solves one- or two-step linear equations; verifies by substitution.
detection_hint: Look for balanced operations on both sides and clear variable isolation.

mastery: Solves ≥3 equations (e.g., 5s+3=18); includes one word problem model.

assessment_item_templates: Solve and check: 5s + 3 = 18; (n/4)+6=10.
teaching_sequence_refs: Algebra > Equations & Relationships > form and solve 1–2 step equations (Y8)

title: Evaluate expressions and formulae with given values
description: Finds the value of expressions or familiar formulae for given variable values.
detection_hint: Look for correct substitution and order of operations.

mastery: Evaluates ≥3 expressions/formulae; states units when appropriate.
partial: Correct substitution; one arithmetic slip fixed after prompt.

assessment_item_templates: Calculate w+12 when w=4; find v=d/t when d=240km, t=3h.

title: Describe and use commutative, associative, and distributive properties

detection_hint: Evidence includes property names, examples, and use to simplify computation.

mastery: Identifies each property and uses it to transform an expression correctly.

assessment_item_templates: Give an example of distributive property and use it to simplify 7×(20+3).

title: Simplify expressions (collect like terms; expand single brackets)

detection_hint: Look for correct term types and coefficient arithmetic.

mastery: Simplifies ≥4 expressions; explains one using property language.

assessment_item_templates: Simplify: 3x+5x−2; 2(x+3)+1.

title: Identify constant difference and write a rule
description: Identifies constant increase/decrease in a linear pattern, expresses the rule with variables, and uses it to make conjectures.

mastery: Finds constant difference and writes a correct rule; predicts future terms.

teaching_sequence_refs: Algebra > Patterns > constant difference and rule (Y7)

title: Determine linearity and write equation for pattern
description: Determines if a pattern is linear and, if so, writes the equation and uses it to make conjectures; supports with table/graph.
detection_hint: Look for representation with (n,term) table and straight-line graph.

mastery: Correctly identifies linearity, writes rule, and uses graph to justify a conjecture.

assessment_item_templates: Decide if the pattern 3, 7, 11, 15,... is linear; write equation and predict 100th term.
teaching_sequence_refs: Algebra > Patterns > determine linear and equation (Y8)

title: Create, test, and revise algorithms (sequences and decisions)

detection_hint: Look for numbered steps/flow chart and evidence of testing/revision.

mastery: Produces an algorithm and revises it after a test case.

title: Use algorithms to identify and explain patterns

title: Use spreadsheet formulas and vary inputs

assessment_item_templates: Filter a class dataset to find who reads >20 books and plays a sport; report counts.

title: Apply the sieve of Eratosthenes

detection_hint: Look for stepwise elimination and justification of why it works.

mastery: Correctly identifies primes up to a given bound and explains reasoning.

assessment_item_templates: On a diagram, label vertically opposite angles and angles on a line.

title: Reason about unknown angles (triangles & quadrilaterals)
description: Finds unknown angles using interior angle sums for triangles (180°) and quadrilaterals (360°) and basic relationships.
detection_hint: Evidence of written equations and angle notation.

mastery: Solves ≥3 problems with equations and correct statements.
not_yet: No rule cited; wrong sum used.

assessment_item_templates: Find x in a triangle with angles 65° and 85°; find a missing angle in a quadrilateral.
teaching_sequence_refs: Geometry > Angles > reason about unknown angles (Y8)

title: Generalise and apply angle rules
description: Generalises and applies: sum round a point 360°, sum on a straight line 180°, vertically opposite equal, interior sums for triangles/quadrilaterals.
detection_hint: Look for rule statements connected to calculations.

mastery: States rule and applies it correctly in a novel case.

assessment_item_templates: Explain which rules you used to solve two angle problems provided.

title: Visualise and draw plan views of 3D shapes
description: Visualises, constructs, and draws plan views (front, back, left, right, top) of 3D shapes.
detection_hint: Look for consistent orientation and alignment across views.

mastery: Produces accurate set of plan views for a given model.
partial: Most views correct; orientation slip once.

assessment_item_templates: Draw front/top/right views of a simple block model on grid paper.

title: Draw nets for prisms
description: Visualises and draws nets for prisms with fixed cross sections.
detection_hint: Look for matching faces and foldability.

mastery: Produces a correct net that assembles into the prism.

assessment_item_templates: Draw a net for a triangular prism and label dimensions.
teaching_sequence_refs: Geometry > Spatial reasoning > nets for prisms (Y8)

title: Resize 2D shapes by whole number or unit fraction
description: Transforms 2D (incl. composite) shapes by resizing using whole numbers or unit fractions.
detection_hint: Look for scale factor application and dimension updates.

mastery: Rescales shapes accurately and labels new dimensions.

assessment_item_templates: Resize a rectangle by a factor of 1/2 and 3; show dimensions.
teaching_sequence_refs: Geometry > Transformations > resizing by whole/unit fraction (Y7)

title: Recognise invariant properties under transformations
description: Recognises which properties (angles, side lengths, area, orientation) remain unchanged under specific transformations.
detection_hint: Look for tests or explanations using tracing paper/rulers/protractors.

mastery: Correctly identifies invariants for reflection, rotation, translation, enlargement.
partial: Mostly correct; confuses orientation vs angle once.

assessment_item_templates: State what changes/doesn't under a reflection and an enlargement.

title: Use coordinates and compass points to describe positions/pathways
description: Interprets and communicates locations with coordinates, angle measures, and the 8 main/halfway compass points.
detection_hint: Look for clear coordinate pairs and compass bearings.

mastery: Describes or follows a pathway using coordinates and compass points accurately.

assessment_item_templates: Give directions from A to B using grid coordinates and compass points.

title: Use map scales and grid references to plan routes
description: Uses map scales, compass points, distance, and turn to interpret/communicate positions; uses 4-digit grid references; calculates distances and efficient routes.
detection_hint: Evidence of scale use and clear route justification.

mastery: Calculates distances via scale and presents an efficient route with grid refs.
not_yet: Scale ignored or incorrect; unclear route.

assessment_item_templates: On a map with 1:50 000 scale, estimate distance between two points and give a route using 4-digit grid references.
teaching_sequence_refs: Geometry > Pathways > map scales & grid references (Y8)

title: Pose an investigative question and conjecture (local context)
description: Poses a clear investigative question about a local matter and makes conjectures about expected findings.
detection_hint: Look for variable, group of interest, and intent in the question.

mastery: Question includes variable/group/intent; conjecture plausible and contextual.
not_yet: Question lacks key elements; no conjecture.

assessment_item_templates: Pose a question about screen time in our class and predict the typical value.

title: Pose investigative question and conjecture
description: As Y7, with attention to different dataset types (summary, comparison, time-series, relationship).
detection_hint: Look for specifying data structure and comparison groups where relevant.

mastery: Question tailored to dataset type; conjecture linked to type.
partial: Adequate question but type not explicit.

assessment_item_templates: Write a comparison question about two sports teams’ scoring this season.

title: Plan data collection ethically
description: Plans how to collect/source data: determines variables, identifies group, and builds awareness of ethical practices via strategic questioning.
detection_hint: Look for a written plan with variables, group, and ethical considerations.

mastery: Complete plan with variables, group, and at least two ethical checks.
not_yet: Missing variables/group or no ethics noted.

assessment_item_templates: Plan how to collect data on daily step counts for our class; include ethics.

title: Plan and explain variables/groups (incl. secondary data)
description: Explains variables and groups in secondary datasets; poses survey/data-collection questions; discusses potential misinterpretations.
detection_hint: Evidence of identifying errors and proposing improvements.

mastery: Explains variables/groups from a provided dataset and drafts improved questions.

assessment_item_templates: Examine a given secondary dataset and rewrite two poor survey questions.

title: Collect data and create an informal data dictionary
description: Collects primary data or gathers info; creates a simple informal data dictionary; checks for errors.
detection_hint: Look for consistent recording and corrections.

mastery: Data table complete; dictionary lists variable names/units/notes; errors corrected.
not_yet: Poor recording; no dictionary; errors unaddressed.

assessment_item_templates: Collect height and shoe size data; build a short data dictionary.

title: Collect/source data; correct errors; document context
description: Collects or sources data; checks and corrects errors; creates a dictionary with contextual notes.
detection_hint: Evidence of error checking and update cycle.

mastery: Finds/corrects errors and documents context in dictionary.

assessment_item_templates: Source a dataset, identify two errors, fix them, and update the data dictionary.

title: Interpret table structure (rows as individuals; columns as variables)
description: Explains table design where rows represent individuals and columns represent variables; identifies variable type.
detection_hint: Look for correct identification and example statements per row/column.

mastery: Interprets two tables correctly and labels variable types.
partial: Understands structure but mislabels one variable type.

assessment_item_templates: Choose a dataset and explain what a row shows; classify each variable.

title: Create appropriate data visualisations
description: Creates appropriate displays for variable types using hand/digital tools; reads, reads between, and reads behind the data.
detection_hint: Look for display–variable type match and commentary beyond the obvious.

mastery: Produces correct displays and provides 'read, between, behind' commentary.

assessment_item_templates: Create a dot plot for heights and a bar chart for sports; write two insights for each.
teaching_sequence_refs: Statistics > Analysis > create displays & read data (Y7–Y8)

title: Describe distributions in context and compare groups
description: Describes centre, spread, shape, and unusual features; compares groups where relevant.
detection_hint: Look for contextual language tied to the investigative question.

mastery: Writes 3–4 sentences naming centre/spread/shape/outliers and linking to context; compares groups.
partial: Mentions two features; limited context link.

assessment_item_templates: Describe the distribution shown in a dot plot and compare two classes.

title: Communicate findings and reflect on conjectures
description: Communicates findings that answer the investigative question; compares to initial conjectures; considers explanations.
detection_hint: Look for concise, justified statements tied to displays and context.

mastery: Presents succinct findings with evidence; reflects on conjectures and possible explanations.
not_yet: Findings unrelated to question or displays.

assessment_item_templates: Write a brief conclusion for your investigation, linking to your conjecture.

title: Evaluate claims using others’ visualisations
description: Evaluates findings of others to check if claims are supported by the data visualisations used.
detection_hint: Look for matching statements to evidence on the graphs.

mastery: Accurately judges if a claim is supported and references specific graph features.
partial: Judgement mostly sound; evidence reference vague.

assessment_item_templates: Given a media chart, decide if the claim is supported; cite features.

title: Evaluate methods, visualisations, and claims
description: Evaluates data-collection methods, visualisations, and findings of others; identifies misleading graphs; justifies statements with interrogative questions.
detection_hint: Look for clear critique of method and graph choice, with probing questions.

mastery: Identifies flaws/misleading features and poses probing questions; makes justified judgement.
not_yet: No critique; takes findings at face value.

assessment_item_templates: Critique a chart and its data-collection method; propose an improved visualisation.

title: Conduct probability experiments and summarise results
description: Plans and conducts probability experiments with many trials (incl. digital tools), visualises outcomes, describes patterns, and estimates probabilities.
detection_hint: Look for a clear investigative question, large n, and a summary display of outcomes.

mastery: Runs ≥100 trials (or digital equivalent), creates a distribution, and estimates probabilities.
partial: Experiment run but too few trials or summary thin.
not_yet: Haphazard trials; no visualisation or estimates.

assessment_item_templates: Simulate 100 spins of a spinner and report outcome frequencies and estimated probabilities.

title: Compare experimental results with theoretical models
description: Plans and conducts experiments; creates visualisations of observed and theoretical outcomes; proposes theoretical outcomes where no model exists; compares results.
detection_hint: Evidence of sample space modelling and comparison commentary.

mastery: Builds a model (list/table/tree), compares to experiment, and explains differences/variation.

assessment_item_templates: Roll two dice 200 times; compare experimental distribution of sums to the theoretical model.

title: Represent outcomes and sample spaces
description: Represents probability outcomes using lists, tables, tree diagrams, tally charts, distributions, words, numbers, and technology.
detection_hint: Look for completeness of sample space and correct probabilities when applicable.

mastery: Constructs complete sample spaces and, when applicable, assigns correct probabilities.

assessment_item_templates: List outcomes for two-coin flips; make a tree diagram for two dice sums.

title: Check others’ chance claims against evidence
description: Identifies, explains, and checks others’ statements about chance-based investigations using interrogative questions and evidence.
detection_hint: Look for alignment/mismatch of claims with experimental/theoretical results and consideration of sample size.

mastery: Accurately judges claims with references to data/model and raises probing questions.
not_yet: Accepts claims uncritically; no reference to evidence.

assessment_item_templates: A friend reports 5 heads in 5 flips and says the coin is biased—respond with evidence and questions.
teaching_sequence_refs: Probability > Critical thinking > evaluate others' claims (Y7–Y8)
